revised_title: George Wallace Kenner: A Pioneering Chemist and His Life
tldr: George Wallace Kenner was a talented chemist born in 1922. He was the son of a well-known organic chemist, James Kenner. George Kenner made significant contributions to the fields of nucleotide coenzymes and phosphorylation during his career. He also had a strong interest in scientific instrumentation and laboratory arts. Despite facing personal challenges and health issues, Kenner had a successful career and made a lasting impact on the world of chemistry.
